page.title: 06Jaxons Farm,Whitminster.
page.content:
As agriculture is such an important part of the local life and economy we surveyed several local farms. One of the local farms is Jaxons Farm. <Jaxons is a curious local mis-spelling of Jacksons>.
The farm itself dates back many hundreds of years but the present farm was laid out in about 1804. It has 10 acres of land and is used to raise steers, pigs and dairy cattle.
One cow requires about one acre of land to graze so the farm cannot support many cows. As a result the calves are usually sold off at around 18 months to 2 years.
Continued on page 7.
